website_summaries.verdict: Affordable option for transporting your kayak that's easy to set up and use.
pros: Compatible with all crossbars and load bars
Made with durable steel and adjustable padding to keep your kayak safe and free from damage
J bar construction makes loading and unloading very easy
cons: The instructions that come with this product are difficult to understand

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you measure before you buy
customer_reviews.text: We had bought this for our 2016 Hyundai Tucson unfortunately it does not fit the factory crossbars in the pictures the cross bars are almost two and a half long and the part that would fit over the crossbars is only one and a half these would be perfect for a smaller roof rack. They seem like they would be very sturdy. Everything came on time nicely packaged just really stinks that they just don't fit!
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line 👍
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about ordering these J-bars because of some of the negative reviews concerning bolt length and measurements, but it was just as I suspected, some people don't understand how a carriage bolt works, and are not good at following directions. These bars are exceptional from the packaging to their design and quality. Once they are assembled, all you ever have to do to take them off, or put them on, is turn the very nicely made nylock nuts. Just remember to line up the squared carriage bolt with the square bolt hole, and tap/pound the bolt down "through" the rubber carrier, as in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: J MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime Warranty Not Honored, Beware.
customer_reviews.text: Well, they were great, until a tree fell on my car during a storm... I bought these with the LIFETIME WARRANTY. I contacted Amazon, I contacted the seller, no one will take ownership of this “lifetime warranty”.... I paid more money to purchase this with the lifetime guarantee and am no satisfied AT ALL. It’s been over a year that I’ve been trying my hardest to get the replacement, but to no avail. WARNING: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS ITEM EXPECTING A LIFETIME WARRANTY. IT WON’T HAPPEN.
customer_reviews.author: Zoya Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: one set bent after one use
customer_reviews.text: The products assembled reasonably well and are holding together securely. The issue is that the 2 racks have been used only once (with kayaks) and one set has bent already. It is not loose - just bent. The center plate that holds everything together has bent. I have contacted the seller and we will see how they respond. Update - Seller refuses to help with the defective product. They could care less. Guess I will try my luck with the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but here's what you should know prior to purchase:
customer_reviews.text: This product provides essential functions as advertised, but I had two major concerns that resulted in deducting two stars from my rating. First, the hardware uses galvanized nuts and bolts instead of stainless steel. This means with repeated exposure to water, they will rust and potentially rust in place on your rack, making removal a nightmare. Second, the tie-down straps provided are short if you have a wide-body recreational kayak. What would have cost them to make the straps just 6 - 8" longer?
customer_reviews.author: Watkino Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 2 sets but Only received one!:-(
customer_reviews.text: Received ONE pair of J bars when the listing clearly lists the price is for TWO pair. Enough mounting hardware for 2 pair. 3 sets of instructions...There is an “Amazon Inspected” sticker on the exterior box, but when the exterior box was opened, the interior box fell out unsealed and dumped all the hardware everywhere. SO disappointed as these have been hanging out in my garage waiting for a kayak trip that I now don’t have the right equipment for. Should have checked as soon as they came in as I now se this has happened to multiple buyers. I also can’t seem to message the seller to get my missed bars. BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Keep them on all summer
customer_reviews.text: These tend to rotate a bit on round crossbars and the foam won't last as long as you hope, but these are sturdy and will keep their shape, even with heavy kayaks like the pair of 2 person ones I use them with. I've traveled western highway speeds with them on and gone offroad with kayaks on the roof and these held on more than fine. I used the included straps as a stern tie down instead of for the main as they seem a bit flimsy and I prefer a ratchet type for my big kayaks in the wind. Don't try to go through an automated car wash with these on your roof.
customer_reviews.author: S S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit all cross bars
customer_reviews.text: The ad is misleading in saying that the racks fit most cross bars. I have a 2015 Toyota RAV4 with factory racks. I’m sure most of them out there are similar to mine as there is nothing special about them. I could get these racks on but they slid all over & wouldn’t hold the kayak. Also, even if the rack fastened sturdy to the crossbars, the plastic bolts are cheap and they’re the only thing fastening the rack to the crossbar so I don’t see how that would support the weight of the kayak. Last... the tie downs are cheap too. Spend the money and buy a good set so you don’t damage your car.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Very weak metal plates
customer_reviews.text: With your kayak up on its side with these racks, it makes your vehicle like a sail boat! The metal plates that connect it to your bars are not strong enough. We had to make thicker plates for the bottom after the second use. Then the top of the plates are giving. I do not feel it is safe enough to continue to use these after only 4 uses. I wish I would have saved my money and purchased hardier ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn K

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied buyer
customer_reviews.text: After reading the negative reviews I was a little hesitant to buy them. Now that I have received them I'm glad I bought these. I assembled and mounted them in very little time. I mounted two 10' kayaks on top of my Explorer with no problems. The construction is of course light weight but plenty sturdy enough to handle their intended load. I had no issues with the racks or the straps working loose like others have mentioned, even after 30 minutes on the highway. As with all items like this, a little common sense and a bit of mechanical skills is all that is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Writing this while taking the price into consideration. Name brand rack run $150-$200 each. This package is 2 for $80. These were difficult to put together. The manufacturing doesn't exactly line up & takes some man-handling & hammering to get together. You will need deep well sockets to tighten. If your cross bars easily come off, I'd recommend putting these on the crossbars without being on the vehicle. The straps don't seem to be the best & I may end up replacing them. Other than that, these do get the job done. I drove for 2 hours on the interstate going 80-100 mph, no crosswinds, without the kayaks attached & had no issues. Would recommend to the casual user.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Taylor-Nuemann

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful with these! The first time I used the 2 sets at the same time, the back rest bent! I was on the highway when it failed. Thank god the ties were tight. Had to pull over very quickly so that the kayak didn't get ruined - ended up not being able to use the J-Bar again. Definitely not worth risking transporting an expensive kayak with these racks.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: They work i guess
customer_reviews.text: They go together very easily with basic house hold tools but the materials they are made of isn't good at all. The foam cracked within a couple of days. I've had them for a year now and the paint looks horrible. I have heavy kayaks and they don't support the kayaks at all. They like to fall off and the long part of the (J) doesn't even cover half of my kayak which created a warp. If your looking for something just to get you on the water then these could work but I would recommend another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Rinchack

customer_reviews.title: The j-bars loosen while driving
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. We didn't go more than 15 miles before our kayaks almost flew off. The bolts that hold the jbars on to the crossbars kept unscrewing during the drive and the jbar would come loose. (Yes they fit the crossbars and yes they were installed properly) We had them as tight as they could possibly go. Went another 5 miles, stopped to check and they were loose again. Absolute piece of junk. We weren't able to make our trip because of it.
customer_reviews.author: RitzSlinger

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy build but the mating fitting is a failure
customer_reviews.text: The racks are sturdy, BUT the mating fitting to my BRIGHTLINES Aero Roof Rack Cross Bars was a complete failure because even with the attaching fitting tightened all the way the racks flopped around loosely. To make the racks fit securely I was able to take a 4" x 2-3/4" x 3/8" sturdy close cell foam piece and place that between the rack and each cross member to achieve a sturdy fit. I do NOT recommend this item to other buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: These didn’t fit the cross bars as they should have. We were desperate and created a cushion from the rubber mats you put on stairs to keep from slipping. In the end, they vibrated so badly that they caused a leak in our camper. The specs just weren’t right, but we bought them well before we were going to use them and missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 set sent. Misleading.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought 2 kayaks and we were excited to get these installed, however, we only received one of the two pairs that were listed in the posting. Just a heads up for anyone who is expecting mounts for two kayaks. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Vasile Carp

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to put together, but they aren't that great. I guess they're OK for the price, but I wasn't confident trusting an expensive kayak in a cheap rack. The racks rotated on the cross bar with any weight added to them despite being tightened as much as possible. Probably would work with a small kayak that you don't care about, but I wouldn't waste my money. I returned these, and ordered some decent Yakima racks.
customer_reviews.author: Beerfish

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I was very leary about ordering these because of the reviews BUT thankfully we did and have had great luck with ours. Got them in the mail yesterday, assembled and used them within the hour. Came with 4 bars to load 2 kayaks. All the pieces were included. Took an hour to put together AND installation was so easy. Tightening the bolts was the most time consuming thing. These fit my 2005 Ford Explorer. I do NOT like the straps it came with they seem very cheap so I’m buying quality ratchet straps.
customer_reviews.author: Ciji Painter

customer_reviews.title: Kayak/SUP carrier
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set to carry a pair of SUP we had purchased. It took me a bit to assemble the first one, but once I figured out a couple of tricks, the rest went a bit smoother. When I installed on my roof rack, I had issues with the carrier sliding on the roof rack. I added some non-slip material to try and help with this. I didn't have issue securing 1 board. When attempting to secure the second board, it was a little more difficult. Most of our trips will be with two boards. I ended up returning these and now secure the boards flat on my roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great racks for kayaks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very universal rack system setup for 2 kayaks. Easy to assemble and mount. I have a Chevy Venture van, so the roof rack bars were wider than the mounts, but it is very secure. I had to order 4 straps, because the ones that were supplied with the racks were only 8.5 feet long. I have 2 9.5 Perception kayaks. The directions said that it was incorrect to secure the straps to the roof rack, and to just feed the straps through the front hook. However, for additional safety, many outdoor kayak shops put the front strap through the front hook, then wrap in under and up through the rack and secure to buckle. You can view this on Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Posovsky

customer_reviews.title: You will get some  wind noise
customer_reviews.text: These hold the kayaks on great. Assembly wasn't too bad and install was easy ( just make sure you use the proper tools to get a real tight fit) The wife has a Vibe Maverick 120 Hybrid Kayak and it hold up just fine. I even put a Pelican Bandit NXT 100 Kayak on the same rack as the Maverick and it's just enough room for both. I used ratchet straps for this set up. I would like for them to fold down but for the price it's pretty good. You will also get wind noise and once their on, you won't want to take them down.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality material and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I am giving 4 stars is because it says, "Will fit most factory or aftermarket round,square,oval and flat crossbars." Well, the connecting plates are designed for round crossbars. They might work with oval and square, depending on the size of the crossbars, but I don' have a way to test it. I personally have standard size flat crossbars and the plate doesn't even come close to fitting around it. I just tightened it as much as I could and hope it won't slip. Beware, if you have flat crossbars, this might not be a good fit for you!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My hubs said these were so much easier than he expected to put together. He said he was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews but he barely had to use the directions and got 4 together in under an hour... Took a little longer to get them installed on the car then, but you get the picture. They have changed our load up game forever, SO CONVENIENT! We used to struggle just the two of us loading up our ocean kayaks and now it's easy peezy. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tay C.

customer_reviews.title: Missing bolts
customer_reviews.text: There’s just nothing like getting ready for vacation and a little kayaking. Paying good money for a kayak rack for the SUV and then finding you have 2 missing specialty bolts that can’t be bought at the hardware store. 2 short carriage bolts with small heads to fit through the rubber support for the J-hooks. I hate poor quality control with a passion. They’re lucky I gave them 2 stars. I suppose I’ll try to get by with 3 bolts on each set and stager them for as much support as I can get.
customer_reviews.author: Randall53

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of J-bar racks! Totally worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: The TMS racks are very solid, reliable kayak carriers. Bells and whistles are not a part of this product. Overall, these racks are a rugged piece of equipment. The tough steel construction should make it a part of your kayaking experience for many years to come. If you assemble and install it with care, maybe add some better load straps or keep it how it is, you will have a great rack system. A very practical choice. I read on other reviews how hard it was to assemble these, I didn't have any issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Living the dream!

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These J bars are good quality and solid. It took a while to assemble the bars and then attach them to the top of my suv. I was extremely disappointed, however, that I couldn't pull out of the garage because the bars didn't clear my garage door opening. And unfortunately the J bars don't have a quick release feature. Would take way too much effort and time to install and uninstall every time I use them. Ended up sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: salvan

customer_reviews.title: Work Well!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Obviously much cheaper than some of the name brands. The foam doesn't hold up to well, but if find that the good-ol' foam pool noodles make a very cheap and almost better replacement. We used these all last summer to haul two 9' kayaks and they worked just fine. I'm thinking the straps won't last too long either but there's easy cheap replacements for that too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No written instructions.
customer_reviews.text: These seemed very sturdy, but there were no written instructions, so I had to look at all of the pictures closely. It’s not easy to install on the cross bars. After my first weekend trip, the under-bar plate had been significantly twisted, and in replacing the bolts, I discovered that one carriage bolt was worn and wouldn’t engage with the square hole and rotated when attempting to install a new nut and washer. A top locking design might be easier, and needs written instructions...
customer_reviews.author: Todd James Steggall

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount and dismount
customer_reviews.text: these work well and are well constructed. An affordable option that is a solid quality option if you do not or cannot justify a mainstream popular rack option. Easy to mount and dismount. We paired these with CargoLoc 2-Piece 52" Aluminum Roof top Cross Bar Set. Max mount time was 20-is minutes for all pieces. Works well for our kayak needs and husband and myself were able to dismount with ease without communicating with each other (both had similar experiences). For hte money htey work well indeed!
customer_reviews.author: E. Livingston

customer_reviews.title: J-bar hard to tighten
customer_reviews.text: We bought these racks for our kayaks. Although they work for the kayaks they aren't the easiest to use. The tightening knobs are a bit awkward as you have to thread them on each time you put the racks on and because they are underneath it makes it very awkward to work with. It might be our car racks but I tighten the J-bar as far as it will go but they are still lose on my car racks. I have to add a cloth or other type material to create enough room in order to tighten the J-bar completely. They do work once all set up but they take some work to get to that point.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Broderick

customer_reviews.title: ** WARNING ** NOT 2 Pairs!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, was I disappointed and scammed by this misleading product, pictures and description. The listing shows 2 Pairs of racks...when upon delivery I only received one. Looking thru other comments I now see where others have been scammed as well. BEWARE. The product itself is fine but not at all what was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Aip

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material/ do not recomend .
customer_reviews.text: Lets start of by saying that the hardware ( nuts and bolts ) need to be grade 8 quality , The hardware is cheap soft material, easily cross threaded and stripped thread . The brackets are an inexpensive soft tubing, in trying to tighten bracket to rack bar, the pipe crushed easily, there for was unable to tighten securely enough to keep the bracket from sliding around. I would not use these for a heavier kayak. I will be returning these .
customer_reviews.author: kiwim8

customer_reviews.title: Work good with some mods.
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a kayak trailer I built from an old boat trailer. The hooks are strong enough and are nice and secure once installed. The included carriage bolts are not long enough if you are mounting to anything other than 1" round tubes. I purchased longer carriage bolts and locking nuts to mount this to a 1-1/4" aluminum tube. I don't trust the included plastic grips to not come loose while hauling. The included straps are long enough to go around a standard size kayak and the teeth hold the strap snug.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Decent Rack - Could Use Better Straps
customer_reviews.text: Took some time to put together and they are a bit of a pain to put on the car and take them back off when they're not needed. However, my biggest complaint is that the straps don't seem to hold all that well. I bought some better straps and they're not much better. I'm not sure what about the design makes the straps go loose but we've had to stop and tighten straps on more than one occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Capn Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great J-hook
customer_reviews.text: Poor instructions, made a few assembly mistakes on first J-hook, but once assembled 1, other 3 were a breeze. Installing is easy, though the curves in the mounting plate are reversed for my applications. These J-hooks have almost flat top plate and very curved bottom plate. My rails are rounded on top and flat on bottom. This results in the J-hook able to rotate forward or back while loading/unloading kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Clemo

customer_reviews.title: Good price and holds up on long road trip
customer_reviews.text: The directions are very basic. No helpful tips. Thankful for reviews on here and other kayak sites. Product is as described. Did a great job for our 12 hour road trip. I brought tools with us in case anything came loose but it wasn’t a problem. My 14 year olds helped me install these. I will get heavier ratchet straps before our next trip. Straps provided worked but are pretty basic (no ratchet) and I did have to tighten them along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Hoops

customer_reviews.title: great price. built strong
customer_reviews.text: great price. built strong. hardware a little low quality (nuts and bolts). bolts are pretty long - I was afraid I would scratch my roof, but that didn't happen. ***UPDATE: this is more of general advice than product review.. Don't get these if your SUV is tall. Very difficult to get a large kayak up there (small ones okay). Since they don't fold (like more expensive ones) you can hit low obstacles. Mine got damaged just with the CLEARANCE SIGN in a parking garage with an extremely low ceiling. Removing them not as quick and easy as they could be. Large wing nuts take a long time to unscrew and can seize up with time (oil would help)***
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money so far
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and install. I have to take them off after each use because of Garage door height. I leave these attached and remove entire cross bar assembly. I have used them 4 times so far. The rubber padding is already ripping. I had to duct tape them back together. The straps are long enough, but one already has wear marks on it. I will be replacing it to ensure it doesn’t break while driving. I will update review as I use them more.
customer_reviews.author: dlarms

customer_reviews.title: Buffalo style kayak racks
customer_reviews.text: This was literally so easy to put together. Any person who thinks this is hard to assemble must be mental cause even my dog could assemble this. They slapped right on to my rack BBQ style with no issues. Would definitely recommend to anyone who is not in an old persons home or anyone who isn't feminist or vegan. Seriously if you get triggered by hotdogs don't buy this. Overall quality seems as strong as my dad's guns used to be 20 years ago. Whoever ripped the foam off of the metal part in the other reviews must have some ratchet ass kayaks, seems pretty durable through my contact lenses.
customer_reviews.author: William Hessemer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if this is worth it
customer_reviews.text: Sloppy design. Giant bolts sticking out towards your roof. I don't see how this is easy to install when you have to use a no loosen nut, which requires a 1/2 " wrench to remove. My Honda pilot is too tall with this rack, can't park it in the garage which means I have to take it off. Taking it off requires tools. Gah. If you have a tall suv, getting the kayaks down requires a tall person with some upper body strength.
customer_reviews.author: Amer

customer_reviews.title: Metal is very thin and due to quality control the pieces are very difficult to get together
customer_reviews.text: These are made with poor supports and too thin of metal material. You'll compromise the racks when torquing them down more than 20ftlbs. They wobble at highway speeds and make a lot of noise when not carrying a boat. Spend a little more and buy a better made rack. I'm stuck with these, but have to order new ones as these are a safety hazard and I'm afraid I'll lose my boats if I keep using them.
customer_reviews.author: SMan

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Sucked
customer_reviews.text: So yes it’s made in China and is a piece of curved metal hollow bar. Can’t expect too much. It works great once it is assembled and mounted to the roof, but that process sucked. Some of the bolt holes don’t line up and putting the two curves together was super difficult. One end was kinda smashed and squared off so I had to beat it into the round hole. The carriage bolts barely fit and I had to pound some of those through. Assembly is awful. But it’s now wrenched onto the top of my roof rack and it is NEVER coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Butler

customer_reviews.title: nice solid two pack with straps
customer_reviews.text: Super solid easy install. Wish they folded, and either came off quickly or were quite difficult to take off. As they are, would be quite easy to steal so maybe best to anchor to roof rails with long cable lock. The "j" racks are a little small but I get the kayak pretty secure. No way for SUP with that curve: the board does not touch padding and the bar would dent the board. So I used one set for kayak and just put SUP flat on roof rack. Decent straps they pull tight and hold securely. Wish they were a little longer and had rubberized or padded buckle.
customer_reviews.author: John Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Service!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable option for transporting two kayaks and found thls came as a set, perfect. The cost was budget friendly and the assembly super easy. I had one small issue where I was missing the nut from one of the cranks. Contacted them through this site and got a reply in less than a half hour! Within 2 hours, they had my replacement part ready to ship. Outstanding and courteous service!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your roof rack
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product. Good price, quality. Just could use a couple things to make it better. A couple different length bolts for mounting. If your roof rack crossbar is thin and low, the bolts are too long and damage your roof. I cut 3/4 of an inch off and they work fine. They also could use lock washers. The mounting hardware loosened up after a 20 mile drive with kayaks on them. Also, a piece of rubber between the hardware and your crossbar would prevent scratches.
customer_reviews.author: knightking

customer_reviews.title: These kayak racks are not made for wide/thin cross bars
customer_reviews.text: These racks are solidly built and fairly easy to assemble. I bought these for my 2016 explorer. These racks actually slid sideways and bent my vehicle roof rack cross bars. My two kayaks actually were hanging off the sides of my car on the highway (i only drive 55 mph and under with the kayaks on top). These racks cannot clamp down to secure it to the cross bars the way the bottom metal bracket is made on the kayak racks.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: RUIN YOUR CAR ROOF WITH THIS P.O.S
customer_reviews.text: Save your money - do not buy this trash. This is a terrible product from start to finish, it's exhausting to assemble - takes so much work to attach to your cross bars that you'll never want to take it off and it scratches the heck out of your roof paint. Then it makes a ton of noise when not in use but again is too much of a pain to take down every time. The padding pealed on the first use and now I can't return nor receive refund because I'm past the window. I should've bough the better quality product to begin with because now I've wasted more money.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good product but missing hardware
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 sets of these that were a little cheaper because they were open box deals or whatever. Put most of them together and discovered I was missing a bunch of hardware in my second box. Luckily I had some nuts and washers that would work and over all it was quite a bit cheaper than not buying the open box ones but it was a little annoying that there were “inspected by amazon” stickers on the boxes but they were missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Blair

customer_reviews.title: Good, but better hardware would help
customer_reviews.text: Durable for the price, but some unnecessary headaches to assemble. Instructions are easy enough, but they provided carriage bolts instead of flathead bolts, so you can’t hold it still when tightening the nuts. Also this is not easy to remove from your vehicle once installed. Just plan on keeping it on your car for the season. The thin straps have been fine for local travel but I will buy large straps for any distance travel. Note the instructions state you cannot drive over 65 mph with these racks, which is disappointing. The racks and the kayaks have not budged during my trips so far, which have involved some highway driving but not a lot.
customer_reviews.author: SomeoneWhoBoughtStuff

customer_reviews.title: Effective and durable
customer_reviews.text: Got this set in the spring of 2019 to haul kayaks on the roof of my Subaru Crosstrek. You'll want a 13mm ratcheting tool to speed up the assembly/disassembly process. The straps appear adequate for holding. I've only carried one kayak on the roof for about 20 miles at modest (55 mph) speed down a state highway, without even noticing that there's something up there. I bought the twin set by mistake -- I only own one kayak, but I can carry two, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelangelo Flores

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to take them out of the box as they appeared to be of sound quality . The assembly also appeared to be easy according to the directions. However, it took me about 90 minutes to assemble as the holes and brackets would not align properly mostly on one of the four units. As I was assembling I predicted that the unit and hardware will certainly rust if left on the car for any extended period of time. I wish I would have applied the cost of these carriers to something more sturdy and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Noworyta-Jubulis

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: You will have to assemble the product but it isn’t a hard task. They are made from great quality and durability. However, I wish there was some kind of padding in between the clamps that grip on your rail system. Mine seem to be able to move around slightly even with the tightening nuts all the way torqued. This problem was minimized once I strapped the top of the holder, around my kayak, and to the rail system. I will be adding some padding in the future though.
customer_reviews.author: Moose Thongkham

customer_reviews.title: Cheap kayak rack
customer_reviews.text: This is an effective way to transport kayaks. Assembly was easy. It's not the quickest to attach to the roof rack, the two sets take about 20 minutes to get on the suv. For the price it's a solid product that works as intended. If you want a set that snaps on/off quickly this isn't it. These are simple and cheap. You should probably get better ratcheting straps in case one breaks, it's bound to happen eventually and you should be prepared in case it happens while you're out.
customer_reviews.author: Morotti Family

customer_reviews.title: Hardware had to be changed
customer_reviews.text: The product is good. Not great. Very light weight and does it’s job. I didn’t like that the hardware was too long for the top of my wife’s 2018 4Runner with stock cross bars. It defintley damaged the paint on top of the vehicle without even putting the kayaks up there. We had to put pieces of cardboard up there until we got shorter hardware. Be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Amazon made a mistake and only sent us 1 pair, but I reached out to the seller and they responded back fairly quickly letting me know they will ship the missing pair. Great customer service! I got this for our 2017 Ford Explorer and it works great, the kayak was easy to put up and hook in and we did not have any issues with it falling off. Great price and great item!
customer_reviews.author: Davion

customer_reviews.title: Durable but slightly difficult
customer_reviews.text: These racks are good. They held up well on a three hour drive on interstate with kayaks in tow. They are somewhat difficult to install. I had to cut the bots provided because they were too long. They are a metric carriage bolt so you cannot easily replace in the US. They tilt when mounted depending on contour of your cross bars. I used with factory luggage rack but I would definitely suggest having an after market base rack.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Hoppe

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a very basic carrier
customer_reviews.text: Setup took awhile. You need some tools. A helper makes it easier to attach them to the crossbars on the vehicle. It's about what I expect for the price. They held the kayaks fine and look like they will last. Very basic j hooks. Definitely carry a wrench the first time to make sure everything stays tight. But don't crush the crossbars by overtightening. Directions are as basic as they come so if you have no mechanical ability you won't like these.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Kayak Rack Assembly and waited a few weeks before installing it on the car. When i did assemble it, i discovered that it had a manufacturing defect and wouldn't allow the short carrier to be fully inserted into the long carrier. I called the company and they said that since it had been purchased more than 60 days prior that i had to take it up with Amazon. All i want is a replacement part that was manufactured correctly. Its their choice to stand behind their products or not and its my choice to give them a bad review. Don't ever buy from T-motorsports.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected from the ad.
customer_reviews.text: They were easy enough to put together and to install on my truck rack. There really were no instructions, just a part list with a blow-up diagram. However, that was enough to put it together if you took care to look at the diagram. No true security features. You will need to secure from theft with something in addition to this rack.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: These J-hooks are NOT easy to attach tightly to most cross bars
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. You get what you pay for. The included straps are basically worthless, DO NOT TRUST THE INCLUDED STRAPS TO HOLD YOUR KAYAK IN PLACE ON THE HIGHWAY! Instead I used high quality ratchet straps, and the product did work for one 15 minute trip to the river. However, it was a major pain getting the nuts to thread on the bolts correctly. These J-hooks are NOT easy to attach tightly to most cross bars. You need to use some serious elbow grease to really tighten them appropriately. Bolts are poor quality and not solidly machined, again DO NOT TRUST THESE TO HOLD YOUR KAYAK ON THE HIGHWAY. Also the hardware came short one nut.Oh well, lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M. Kopchick

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on my 2005 Subaru Outback!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried at first this might not fit. I was also skeptical of the low cost as the name brand racks cost many time more. It fits and it works! I transported two kayaks (A Dagger Katana 9.7 and an 8 foot Sun Dolphin) on a 4 hour trip up the interstate with zero issues. Even the included straps are pretty decent. The only disadvantage is it is kind of a PITA to install.
customer_reviews.author: Little Mushroom

customer_reviews.title: No nuts and bolts for second set!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these and so excited to finally get them on the car, dealing with the end of life of a family. So today we felt like putting them on. Got one set on and opened the second box and darn no nuts or bolts, only the racks and straps and the hardware to go on roof rack. I tried to call and they were closed. So I just suggest just don’t wait to open. I feel like it was just an error on who ever packed it. Oh well we all make mistakes
customer_reviews.author: rene seckman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality... bolt anchors strip out when removing from cross bars.
customer_reviews.text: Used for one trip and one of the main bolts stripped out the square hole it is supposed to anchor to when I was trying to loosen it to take them off my car cross bars. Now I have kayaks, but can’t take them anywhere. I contacted the seller and still haven’t heard back. Will update my review pending the outcome of return or replacement of broken part.
customer_reviews.author: ZF

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We've only been using for a season for our yaks but so far so good. My husband assembled and installed by himself and said it was really easy. We did notice after a few trips out that they came a little loose and needed to be re-secured. All around nice quality. Hoping to get a few years out of them. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: MommaOfFive

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: The cradle is great-sturdy, easy to assemble and holds kayaks. The straps are useful and secure. The only downside is the part that connects the cradle to the roof rack. The system requires you to balance the cradle atop your crossbar and then spin 4 nuts onto two bolts without anything dropping and scratching your roof. I don’t know how to do it, but if it had some kind of cam lock system I’d give it six stars.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H Clarke Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Decent value, but design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Decent value, but the product has some design flaws. They are more narrow than other J racks and they do not have springs in the tightening bracket. Also, to secure the racks involves a nut and a hand tightener. Having both is awkward and more difficult than a stand-alone hand fastener. Not as high quality well designed as other J racks that I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Burke

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic rack for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: The rack are made to fit larger luggage rack style cross bars. But with basic fab skills, I flattened the bottom clamp brackets, and made it fit my jeep safari rack. The straps that come with it are plenty strong for securing our big recreational kayaks, but the height of our jeep makes rigging them very difficult. I welded a couple pieces of flat bar between the uprights to tie them together facilitating the use of a single strap across both kayaks. All in all, I'm super happy with the simple, yet effective design!!
customer_reviews.author: Philip A Durrett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and they look good
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to install and they look good and seem to be made very well, I installed them on my 2015 JK unlimited. I have them on the Thule Areoblade so the bottom doesn't fit perfect but I was happy with the way it tightened and stayed put. Drove 6 hours with these 11.5' long, 52 pounds apiece kayaks and didn't have a single problem, nothing moved or came loose, at an average speed between 60 - 65 mph.
customer_reviews.author: JDW

customer_reviews.title: Great, with a bit of extra...
customer_reviews.text: Apparently you get ONE set! Description says 2 pairs..."pair" means 2 of an item, like socks. Made me think I was going to have the ability to haul my 2 kayaks, guess not. My pic shows what you will end up with. Kinda frustrating. ALSO - my friend has a set and said she put a small piece of rubber between metal brackets...I installed without, but I see why she did, makes it a bit more sturdy. Will find a piece and do the same. Mine are cinched down tight so shouldn't move, but have just a bit of "give". Would rather be on the safe side. Otherwise great purchase and glad i got them. About to mount my kayak...
customer_reviews.author: Steph Payne

customer_reviews.title: Can Hold 2 Kayaks on Toyota Rav4 2017 Roof racks
customer_reviews.text: Took me 1 hour to install on my RAV4 2017 LE. I purchased these to pair with the crossbars (Summates Universal Roof Top Cargo Rack Cross Bars-1Pair, 47" Cross Bar) available on Amazon in order to fit two kayaks (Pelican Trailblazer 100 NXT Kayak) on top of my vehicle. The Jbars can easily support the weight of both kayaks, which weigh 36 lbs each. I also noticed that the J-bars do not rattle when I drive on the highway. I've attached a photo of the whole set up to show what the crossbars and J-bars are capable off.
customer_reviews.author: Z. B.

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be on par with many much more expensive options. My first set had a bad bolt, but I had another in the bin that worked. Second set had no issues. So total, I ordered 4 racks. These fit my Yakima round bars fine, but there is a gap in the middle of the clamp when I put them on my stock Subaru bars. They seem to hold fine. So far I’m very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hite

customer_reviews.title: They work, but they're difficult. I like them
customer_reviews.text: They're very sturdy once a month amount but they're very hard to mount, one of the problems is when you have a car and have a garage, they got to be able to fit through the garage door so you have to take them on and off. The washers fall off and I lost easily and tightening is a pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: Happy go lucky!

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Look no further for a kayak roof rack!
customer_reviews.text: These have been great so far! Don’t believe the reviews that say they’re hard to put together. If you can do a small LEGO set, you can handle these. Just follow the instructions. Mounting them to the roof rack does take a few minutes to get things screwed on tight but it’s easy! My only wish is that the straps it comes with were longer.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Cade

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for a kayak and paddle board. It delivers without issue and it was easy to assemble with easy to follow direction. This was important since I am not great at following assembly directions.
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: For the price they decent.
customer_reviews.text: First impression was, why are the bars not as thick as the plates? The poles seem a little too thin for my personal liking. With the plate design they will rotate if you dont have anything strapped to them. Used them 1 summer now they are in the garage so well see if they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: These work well at holding up a Sit on top 10ft kayak. When installing, I recommend screwing one side of the bottom tightening bracket into the J-hook. This way, you will not need to tighten the washer, bolt, and spinner on both sides of the bottom bracket when installing or removing the J-hook. The straps are terrible and I recommend buying a separate set that is more durable and less likely to release. Also, install a bow and stern line to the kayak so that you will not injure anyone on the road. You may even want to tie your kayak down with multiple straps or an additional rope on each J-hook/ rack crossbar .
customer_reviews.author: Florida Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Bad hardware, for what appears to be an otherwise ok product
customer_reviews.text: Well. I was really hoping I'd like these j bars due to the positive reviews. But after spending an hour tonight trying to make them work with the hardware included and then with my own hardware after the included hardware failed, I've given up and will be returning. The big bolts that go through the middle of the rubber peice are pushing completely through their slots when even a small amount of pressure is applied. I'm not sure if this is a design flaw or if I just recieved a bad unit but it's just way more hassle than it needs to be. I'lll send back and spend a little more for a folding set.
customer_reviews.author: Ladispute

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased these for a weekend camping trip with kayaks. When mounting them on my CR-V, I first wrapped a small piece of towel around the crossbar to prevent scratches and fill up void space since the mount didn't fit the crossbars exactly. We used the straps that came with, although I would have preferred something a little more sturdy. All in all, we traveled over 300 miles round trip through rain and shine and didn't have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: lthomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to transport 2 single sit on top kayak with a family van. Each of the provided 4 straps is just long enough to go around one kayak. For additional security, I would suggest to get two additional 15' straps to secure both kayak together and secure them to the front and back of vehicle with paracords. No worries for me even traveling at 80mph. Assembling them is easy and just need a little bit of time for 4 bars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits our 14ft MadRiver Canoe.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rack to hold our single occupant kayak and our 14ft canoe. None of the pictures we saw showed a canoe on the rack so here you go. It fits nicely and there is no strap buzz while driving. The straps that csme with the rack were too short for our canoe so if you don't have longer ones you will have to get some. Quite pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Took me a 1.5 hours to install and I did it alone without a man’s help. Overall the instructions aren’t very clear so common sense is a must. Once you install the first one the others come easier. The parts are individually packed . There are several videos on YouTube for guidance. I recommend watching the tie down videos too because I winged it and my kayak kept falling off the J.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great, even on small cars!
customer_reviews.text: I’m incredibly happy with these! I was so easily able to put 2 kayaks on my Camry and the straps stayed really tight! Even after driving on the interstate! I added a few bungees on the front just to keep the noses down and closed the windows up on the excess straps so they would stay tight and not flap around. Only gave it a 4 because the box didn’t contain directions of any kind to put the j hooks together or attach them to your roof rack. Clearly I figured it out, but it would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with these
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with these, they aren't the highest of quality but they do the job. I was a little nervous at first driving with two kayaks strapped on the interstate but I didn't exceed the recommended speed of 60mph. They are a little shaky but this is my first time owning a kayak better yet traveling with them on the top of my car, could just be me being paranoid. Overall I'm satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Use ratchet straps.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely listen to the other reviews that suggest using your own straps. I tried the straps that came with and the Kayaks were very lose and bounced around a lot. I used my own ratchet straps and had no problems at all. It is time consuming and annoying having to take them on and off every time- my Honda Pilot doesn’t fit in my garage with them on, but for the price, it’ll work.
customer_reviews.author: SmartDoula

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Got to hold us over until we got a thule or Yakima rack but these did so well we'll be getting a second set of these as the higher dollar rack reviews actually look worse than the TMS. A couple things the padding rips pretty easily and the straps aren't great but it is an easy fix by getting stronger tie down straps. We usually take them 5-20 miles at 40-45mph but have gone as fast as 70mph with them with no problem. Will be taking them on a 120 mile highway trip this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Naturally Ashlie

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, very happy with items
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set of racks (sadly I only received one, but Amazon filled the order and they are working on getting this resolved). The Racks were easy to put together and they worked great with my crossbars. I have a 2018 Honda Pilot and I am glad I got the Honda Crossbars when I purchased the vehicle. The only issue I had was the bolts were a bit hard to tighten because there was no way to turn hold it in place on one end. Hard to explain, but ultimately it worked. Definitely recommend these racks.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Malaga

customer_reviews.title: Assembled easily and is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I received this a few days ago and decided to mount it on my 2014 Honda CR-V with factory roof rack. Everything was in the box and all the parts were in a clear plastic sheet so you could see them and count them. The result is a perfect fit and very very strong. I advise purchasers to assemble one of them first and install it, then the others. You'll need a half-inch socket wrench and a half-inch regular wrench to make the job go fast.
customer_reviews.author: Scratch Duffer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is someone could remove these from your rack in about 2 min per side, but you could always remove them and toss them into the car once you remove your kayak
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Not for round bars
customer_reviews.text: Took about an hour to put together. The description indicated that these were suitable for all roof racks, both flat and round bars. I have a Yakima rack that has round bars. It does not fit. They have only a single attachment plate on the bottom and it is impossible to tighten them enough to keep from rolling over. Don't buy these if you have a round bar roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O. Wansleben

customer_reviews.title: Quality J bars
customer_reviews.text: The straps it comes with are fairly small. They work great for driving around the city though, I do use ratchet straps to tie the kayak down along with the straps provided if going on the highway. One other thing to mention, make sure you measure your cars roof rack and make sure they align. You don’t want to buy these and not have them fit to your cars rack. Very sturdy and hold up well through weather.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: but the diagram made for easy assembly, and attached easily to my after market ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very nervous to trust my brand new kayaks on top of my car traveling down the highway, but they arrived at our destination snug and secure. While it's hard to believe two straps can secure a 41 pound kayak, they certainly seem durable and strong enough to do the job well. They came without listed instructions, but the diagram made for easy assembly, and attached easily to my after market Rhino-Rack roof rack system. I look forward to using them frequently and will certainly recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Beidel

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 11’ Kayaks
customer_reviews.text: The parts came nicely packaged and were very easy to put together. My husband had to do the actual installation on my Subaru Impreza for me. The racks were installed as far left and right as possible to fit our 11’ Kayaks and worked perfectly after securing them with the enclosed straps. They look cool too, my 25 year old son says on my car!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money, beats using a pool noodle on your roof.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together if you take 30 seconds to look at the diagram. Look identical to the atwood branded ones i seen at the store for $70+ per set. Finish is fine, seems like it should last awhile. The mount does have a bit of play on my cross bars, not enough to worry about and once the kayak is up there they are solid. The included straps dont quit fit around my 10' fishing kayak bit its wide. Only downsides are that the included straps are short, and the soft foam on the lower half probably wont last long if you leave them mounted outdoors for long. Both are cheap and easy to fix if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Duckworth

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase! These J Hooks work great for hauling kayaks on top of your vehicle! They are affordable, durable, and sturdy! They stay put, however as a safety measure we always check them for tightness and security. If it feels slightly loose at all tighten and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Value suits the product
customer_reviews.text: It was a little smaller than we expected. But I still believe I got more than my moneys worth. We use these a little bit differently then originally designed. But they still work well. Instead of installing them on a crossmember we bolted them directly to a trailer. We only needed to get a few more longer bolts. One big problem I had with this was the packaging. All of the nuts and bolts were shrink wrapped in bubble wrap in my opinion this was overkill and made it very difficult to open not to mention it doubled our installation time.
customer_reviews.author: faith

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the included straps
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my 2013 Toyota 4Runner with the oem roof rack and cross bars. The overall construction of the holders themselves is solid. However, I had to use different bolts to attach kayak holders to the roof rack because the bolts included were too long. My main issue with the product is the straps included. I actually ripped one of them apart trying to cinch it right. After I used my own ratchet straps, I felt comfortable enough to hit the road. I traveled about 150 miles on my trip and everything worked out great. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really glad I went through with purchasing these kayak racks. Reading the previous reviews had me going back and forth about buying them but I’m glad I did! Some people complained about all the pieces that came with it and that there was a lot of assembling but it was really simple and not hard at all to put together. After an additional purchase of crossbars for my Ford Escape, they fit perfectly on my vehicle and are very sturdy! I am using the straps that came with the racks right now and they work well but I plan to buy better straps soon. I would definitely recommend purchasing these! Great quality, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: Get longer straps... But get these!!
customer_reviews.text: Why pay so much more for similar J-Bars? Don't! This worked great. They do not fold down, but hey... I can find my Rav. 4 in any parking lot easy! And they are great conversation starters!! But seriously, work as intended for a fraction of the cost of others!
customer_reviews.author: Mabilu

customer_reviews.title: Takes some work
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. BUT, it does take some work to get then put together BEFORE you can attach then to you roof rack. And then, taking them on and off the existing rack is a chore. Not hard, just tedious. Otherwise, it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Stephane Budge

product_meta.title: Lifetime Warranty TMS® 2 Pairs J-Bar Rack HD Kayak Carrier Canoe Boat Surf Ski Roof Top Mount Car SUV Crossbar
product_meta.description: KAYAK CAR TOP CARRIER A simple, low-cost solution to carrying your kayak ITEM#: KAYAK-RK-J(2SET) CONDITION: BRAND NEW QUANTITY: 2 PAIRS This Kayak Carrier designed mounts to virtually all crossbars and load bars on the market. The carrier secures the kayak on its side, consuming minimal space on the load bar. As shown in the pictures we put the Kayak Rack on the Ladder Rack Bar.(sold separately). A maximum of 4 sets of kayak racks can be mounted on a full size truck. Save your space. Features: Steel design with adjustable padding for carrying strength and kayak protection Wide mouth J bar offers easier loading and unloading Quick on/off hardware ensures fast installation and removal Optimally sized J style carrier leaves roof space All surface rust-resistant coating and hardware for longer product life Includes all mounting hardware and 2 straps Accommodates kayaks up to 36" wide and 75lbs Will fit most factory or aftermarket round,square,oval and flat crossbars.The crossbars shown in the pictures are not included. ~PLEASE CHECK MEASUREMENTS BEFORE PURCHASE~
feature_bullets: KAYAK CAR TOP CARRIER A simple, low-cost solution to carrying your kayak ITEM#: KAYAK-RK-J(2SET) CONDITION: BRAND NEW QUANTITY: 2 PAIRS

This Kayak Carrier designed mounts to virtually all crossbars and load bars on the market. The carrier secures the kayak on its side, consuming minimal space on the load bar. As shown in the pictures we put the Kayak Rack on the Ladder Rack Bar.(sold separatly). A maximum of 4 sets of kayak racks can be mounted on a full size truck. Save your space.

Features: Steel design with adjustable padding for carrying strength and kayak protection Wide mouth J bar offers easier loading and unloading Quick on/off hardware ensures fast installation and removal Optimally sized J style carrier leaves roof space All surface rust-resistant coating and hardware for longer product life Includes all mounting hardware and 2 straps Accommodates kayaks up to 36" wide and 75lbs. Compatible with most crossbars and load bars
LIFETIME WARRANTY- Your satisfaction is the most important to us and we offer limited lifetime warranty for our kayak rack carrier. If you have any concerns with this product, please contact us.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,669 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
